Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for its location”
Reviews.Author: donperico Posted by an Halcon Viajes traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my family during a week occupying two rooms and we remained very happy. The hotel is quite normal, nothing special but we wanted a center acommodation to move easily through the city. The rooms although basics, were OK, confortable beds, perfectly clean bathrooms and the maid was very attentive with the cleanliness and order. The breakfast room is quite pretty because is a covered terrace. The breakfast is wide and rich for being for a three star hotel (eggs, sausages, bacon, toast, cereals, fruits, nutella, buscuits, juices, croissants and yogurts). With this breakfast is enough to give you energy for the day! The waiter was very polite and kind. The elevator is small but works perfect during all our stay. We had no problems as it is written in another reviews. Our rooms faced the street so was quite noisy during the night due to the traffic, but fortunately we could sleep perfectly because we were very tired to walk all the day. But maybe you could bring with yourself earplugs, just in case. Suming up, I totally recommend this hotel because the location is the must (one minute walking to the Fontana di Trevi or five to the Panteon square) and its value for money. Of course, do not expect any luxury but... who wants luxury in a hotel in Rome with such a wonderful city? (lol)

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: girbi
Reviews.Content: This hotel has one of the best location in Rome minutes away from the main attractions of Piazza di Spagna, Trevi Fountain, Piazza Navona & Piazza del Popolo. You can actually spend your holiday without using the public transport once. There are loads of good restaurants & pizzerias nearby and also shopping. Staff at hotel is very helpful & courteous whilst the breakfast is enough. Rooms where tidied every day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Good Standard Hotel”
Reviews.Author: aformosa
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location with Trevi fountain round the corner and the Spanish Steps 8 mins walk. Via del Corso linking Piazza Venezia & Piazza del Popolo (also good for shopping) is 100 meters away. A multitude of restaurants and pizzerias within walking distance. In our 4 day visit only used Metro once to go to far places. Pantheon, Colosseum, Roman Forum, Piazza Navona & Vatican are all within walking distance. Rooms comfortable for a 3 star and a good breakfast was included in the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: MollyMary516
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location where you can walk to most major attractions - located just steps away from Trevi fountain and about a 5 minute walk to the Pantheon. The Tritone hotel is close to the Barberini metro stop and Bernini's Tritone fountain, but it is about a 3-4 block walk (5+ minutes). We used the Metro to get to further away attractions like St. Peter's Basilica and the Vatican. From what I understand, there are two types of rooms - renovated and not. We stayed in what I assume is a renovated room. It was modern and clean, perfect for our needs as a young couple traveling to Rome for a few days. The room was a little loud as other guests came back to their room at night.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel central location.”
Reviews.Author: Been_there_dk
Reviews.Content: Very friendly reception of the hotel staff. The rooms are nice and clean. The only drawback I found was that the lift didn't work if somebody forgot to close the door to the lift and there is a long way from fifth floor to the hotel entrance. Sorry another drawback is the noise from the street, but maybe I am just sensitive/sleep lightly. The breakfast is fine according to Italian standards :-) The beacon is not according to Danish standards as it is only slightly roasted and thus not crispy.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Cape Town, Western Cape, South Africa
Reviews.Title: “Good hotel at a GREAT location”
Reviews.Author: SchalkL
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Tritone. It is situated in the heart of Rome, with everything being walking distance from there. The service was very good and helpful and the rooms modern, clean and well equipped. One of the best features was breakfast at the restaurant on the top floor. We enjoyed the really old/historic little elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good rooms & nice breakfast”
Reviews.Author: SydneySkier
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location just around the corner from the Trivi Fountain and along the road from the Pantheon. It has good rooms & a nice breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accommodation, a stone's throw from the Trevi Fountain”
Reviews.Author: Phil S
Reviews.Content: Very friendly retreat in the heart of Rome. Knowledgeable and helpful staff. Stayed for three nights in late August. Spacious room, excellent facilities and varied breakfast overlooking rooftops- what a find!

Reviews.Title: “A nice small hotel in the heart of Rome.”
Reviews.Author: Sergel_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel with my daughter for four days in June. The location is great! Walking distance to many attractions. Our walk to The Coliseum took us only 20 minutes. The Trevi Fountain is near the hotel. The staff were helpful and friendly. The room was rather large. Air condition in the room was well. It is very important because of the Roman heat in summer.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Hildepav
Reviews.Content: My husband and I reviewed a lot of hotels in Rome before deciding on Hotel Tritone. We really enjoyed staying here. It was very modern. I did listen to past reviewers and booked a room on one of the higher floors. The room was a nice size. The breakfast in the morning was great! We loved the location of this hotel. Great location for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: TAT_10
Reviews.Content: Hotels location was great! And cleaning lady Luciana was so wonderful and kindly... But the hotel was too noisy!! I had to buy ear plugs, and beds were like a rock. Hotel was much too expensive. I learned not to hurry when reserving hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location and Hi-Tech Room”
Reviews.Author: SUAlavi
Reviews.Content: What can I say.....round the corner from the luminous trevi fountain and walking distance from most major piazzas save the St Peter's Basilica. Clean room and bathroom with basic but decent breakfast buffet. But honestly, the location of this hotel cannot be beat with the metro and bus stop a three minutes walk away. A solid 3 star hotel with helpful staff and a price that won't break the budget!

Reviews.Title: “An Honest review of the Tritone”
Reviews.Author: Denman2008
Reviews.Content: I booked the Tritone as a christmas present for my Mother, and got a great deal on the hotel. Overall our stay was brilliant, Rome is a beautiful city and I would recommend a visit to everyone! First for the bad points (there were not many, but lets get them out of the way!) The rooms were not what you would call sound proof! I think it was more the fact that our room was located over a very busy road, at night the constant sirens and traffic could make it difficult to sleep, it was pretty noisy, but to me only a minor problem. I also found that you could hear people in other rooms even if they were just talking, again not a huge problem for me but if you really value your sleep maybe consider staying in a quieter area... Not really a bad point about the hotel but do beware of the driving! Be extremely careful when crossing the roads as the italians do not necessarily stop at crossings and will drive around you even if your in the middle of the road! (they say the best way to cross is to step out boldly!) Now for the good :) We stayed in a superior room and I would recommend paying the extra for one as they were considerably better than the basic room. The beds were comfortable, room was cleaned daily and the minibar was a nice touch (albeit expensive at 3.50EURO for a can of soda) The location of the hotel itself was fantastic! everything was within comfortable walking distance (Vatican city around 30 minutes, colloseum 20 minutes) and the trevi fountain was just 5 minutes away which was lovely! for location this hotel definitely gets a 10 out of 10! The staff in the hotel spoke perfect English and were very friendly and happy to help with any queries. The breakfast was pretty good, although if your someone expecting a full english/american breakfast you will be disappointed, the breakfast is minimal although there is a lovely selection of coffee and fresh cakes. And the view from breakfast is just lovely. There is no lunch or dinner facility but there is a cafe in the sister hotel (accademia) which is just 2 minutes away! Overall I would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay there again, its the perfect base for all the sightseeing! A few tips! Like any other city be aware of pickpocketers, particularly around tourist traps like the trevi fountain, women should also wear cross body bags just to be on the safe side. A cab from the airport should be no more than 45EURO so don't get conned! When visiting the colloseum wear comfortable shoes because all them stairs can be hard on your feet! I would reccomend an open top bus tour, that way you see everything! Be aware that it can be quite pricey, but there are good value restaurants so always read the menu prices before you go in! The Hard Rock cafe is just a 10 minute walk away and is fantastic although not traditional! You get alot of street sellers (generally perfectly nice people) roses, toys, pictures etc, be polite but firm with them otherwise they won't leave you alone! The shops in Rome are fantastic so don't leave without participating in a bit of retail therapy! I visited in January and the weather was fine for sightseeing, quite cold but bright! Try to avoid the summer because Ive heard its stiflingly hot and not ideal for walking around!

Reviews.Title: “A taste of Olde Style Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Cleopatra030
Reviews.Content: I absolutely enjoyed the quantness of this small hotel, situated around the corner from the Trevi Fountain. I found it very centrally situated as we were in walking distance to all the major spots. The Concierge/Receptionist was always very helpful and pleasant. It has an old fashioned tiny lift that just fits two people but it is beautiful. The room we were in was suitably sized, and although on a busy main road, the windows were double glazed and blocked out all noise, and we slept peacefully. The bathroom was lovely with a huge shower. Breakfast was excellent. We stayed at a few other hotel during our trip to Italy but none had the particular charm that the Tritone had. I definately would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “good hotel in a wonderful location (city center)”
Reviews.Author: dizzy33traveller
Reviews.Content: i believe that the location of the hotel is great and the hotel conditions are good for its price...

Reviews.Title: “Pricey & Great location, but the bed was rock hard!”
Reviews.Author: ana_w1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night after a cruise for our honeymoon. We hadn't been organised and booked this last min on the day. The location was perfect, right around the corner from the Trevi fountain and on same road as tour buses etc. The hotel however, was well overpriced for what it had to offer (£200+ per night). Upon entering this small hotel, you are greeted with a flight of stairs and at the time there was no porter to help us up with our luggage. The gentleman on reception was austere and did not rush to serve us, although he was helpful in terms of trains and further information, speaking fluent english. The lift/elevator was very old and tiny, I avoided using it. We were on the first floor in one of the modernised rooms. It was on the small side, although adequate. The rooms were modern with wood and tiles, however, they were very clinical. The bathroom was lovely and modern, althought the shower was tiny, so small, my husband couldn't close the shower cubicle door. The sink had a drainage problem in our room (room 102). There was a music system and lighting control panel above the bed which was a nice touch and I see other reviews on here that liked that, however, we couldn't get the music function to work (not sure if the fault was ours or that particular room). Our room had a small balcony off of it which was a nice touch. My biggest complaint however, was the bed. It was two singles pushed together to make up a (rather small) double and honestly, it was the hardest bed I have ever experienced in my enitre life. The bed could double as a table if you wanted it to, it was rock solid! I was convinced it was just an upholstered bed base with no mattress on, until I checked. And the pillows were flat as pancakes. Very uncomfortable night's sleep for both of us. Also, we could hear doors being closed/slammed in the corridor and movements in the hall way which woke us up early in the morning. Having said that, if you like the location, don't mind average service and are after modern clinical rooms with extremely hard beds, then I would recommend this hotel. But make sure you get a better price then we did. The breakfast was nice, although avoid the horrible orange squash. Tritone hotel, please invest in some comfortable, larger beds, carpets to minimise the corridor noise, dressing gowns/slippers in the rooms and fresh orange juice at breakfast and then I would have no complaints.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Vila Real de Santo Antonio, Portugal
Reviews.Title: “Good location = Good price”
Reviews.Author: MartaFerrer
Reviews.Content: The Tritone Hotel became the perfect spot for our vacation: its centric location allows to wander around in the highlight places of Rome without depending on public transports - the hotel is surrounded by plenty of things to do, from shopping to sightseeing, from restaurants to bars and conected with a good network of transports (subway it's about 10 minutes away). The hotel, recently restructured, offered the basic amenities for our stay, really well cleaned, cosy, with a good diary mantenance and sound-proof rooms. The breakfast takes place in the roof garden, although there are no 'special' views, is a great way to beggin the day!

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I every stayed at.”
Reviews.Author: EllenBaron
Reviews.Content: The service was very poorand the desk clerks were very discourtious. The room was extreamly small and very noisy. The elevator was often out of service and we were on the 4th floor. Staff saw we were waitng for elevator and just ignored us. We were there for 7 nights. The lobby was dirty,shabby and very unattractive. The location was excellent, around the corner from the Trevi Fountain. That is the reason I chose this hotel. I made the reservation via the internet. The pictures were not as they appear. We paid more than 250 American dollars per night. I would never refer anyone to this hotel.. We were in Paris and London on this trip and stayed at wonderful hotels. The breakfast was also less than acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty & Depressing”
Reviews.Author: Adrienne48
Reviews.Content: We were stranded in Rome and had to find a hotel without doing any research. What bad luck to draw this place! The shower was teeny and moldy, we didn't even use it even though we were needed to clean up after a frustrating day. The carpet was gross and the room was noisy. The TV room where you could pay to use the internet was also dirty and disgusting. Don't go there!

Reviews.Title: “Great location enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: JaneC7
Reviews.Content: Clean with modern rooms and friendly staff. Nice breakfast on the top floor with views over the roof tops of Rome. The location is great for sight seeing and within walking distance of many good shop & restaurants. We had a room on the front over the main road, and could hear the traffic, which went on well into the night, not a problem for us just like being in any big city. There were a few rooms at the back of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, central, nicely furnished hotel”
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from staying with some friends at the Tritone Hotel. All facilities were very modern in the room, and the hotel was in an ideal location for sightseeing. Breakfast was available until 10.30 which was nice if you don't want to get up too early, it was set up in a rooftop breakfast room, with a view over the city. Our flight didn’t leave until late on the last day, and we were able to leave our bags at reception whilst we did shopping which was very handy. The room was a bit noisy in the morning due to the fact that the hotel is on a main road, but it is double glazed and you are in the heart of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money and very good location”
Reviews.Author: Dimitra78
Reviews.Content: It was obvious the room (101) was recently renovated, it was very clean, comfortable and fully equiped, although a bit small. The location was fantastic, very close to Trevi Fountain, Via Condotti and Piazza Montecitorio, that is in walking distance of everything that must be seen in Rome's historic center. The breakfast room was at the last floor of the building and had a beautiful roof-top view. The staff were very helpful and spoke fluent English. What i liked least, was the noise- it was annoying coming both from inside the hotel (people speaking in the corridors) as well as outside (traffic from the street) and it was annoying, especially in the night.

Reviews.Title: “Best Feature: Moldy Shower Head and Blood Stained Sheets & Mattresses”
Reviews.Author: Nick_in_NY_from_LA
Reviews.Content: You may think this is a bad review. I promise you it is the truth down to the final punctuation. Hotels.com gave me a refund. I think the best feature of our stay was the mold on the shower head. Either that or the water leaking onto the floor from the bathroom ceiling or blood stained mattresses. Either one or the other, I can't decide. The air conditioner did not work and the thermostat shocked me when I touched it. Every morning I woke with a pain in my back. When the thermostat started sparking into the room (in all seriousness) we called for maintenance and after 45 minutes and three more calls the repairman arrived but would not fix the problem without another call to hotel management. He actually tried to convince us that he had indeed solved the problem multiple times but it was clear after our multiple complaints to management that he just did not want to get into the ceiling and actually fix the problem, providing the luxury let alone the safety that $450 a night should pay for. My wife and I asked for a queen bed, but found that we actually were given 2 cots pushed together. My sister who came with us was promised a cot, but got a very small broken pullout with what we can only assume was a blood stain. Our sheets were never cleaned during the entirety of our stay despite requests. We were also followed into the hotel by a man in the evening and the hotel offered no security to alleviate the situation. Instead, they allowed him to follow us. We evaded him by switching floors on the elevator a couple of times. Our card keys to the room didn't work, we had to have it replaced several times and by the end of our stay they had quit working all together. A call to the front desk did not solve the problem, I was told they were to busy to deal with our situation, but when I had gone down the girl behind the counter I spoke to was alone and literally playing an online video game called "Vampire Wars." The same happened when I wanted to know how much the water was in the refrigerator. I asked the price and she told me to come down and check for myself. She was again too busy playing "Vampire Wars." The room was overall very gross and disgusting. The walls were padded and VERY dirty, as were the curtains. The floor in our room was VERY stained and had obviously been in need of a vacuuming for maybe the past six months. Both the Sink and tub did not drain, and when you flushed the toilet water and excrement would splash out onto the floor mixing with the water already dripping from the ceiling. I would only recommend this hotel to someone I wished to succumb to small pox or perhaps a remnant of the plague virus, and at $450 a night I wouldn't recommend it to anyone at all. Steer clear, there are better hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Tritone helped make the trip!”
Reviews.Author: Erynstar25
Reviews.Content: The hotel slightly messed up our reservation and didn't have any rooms available our first night, so they put us up in their sister hotel (Hotel White - 4 Stars). We got a beautiful presidential suite, complete with 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms and 2 floors! They transported our stuff back to Tritone the next day at our convenience and put us in the 'superior room' instead of the 'standard room' we reserved. It was a beautiful style, comfortable and friendly staff. Would definitely stay there again! Also, great location.

Reviews.Title: “OK if you are there just for the time you sleep”
Reviews.Author: German_RedSox
Reviews.Content: The standard room I had was really small. The bathroom door could not be fully opened because of the bed, and the way around the bed was partially blocked by the mini-bar fridge. The bathroom window did not shut tight so it was rather chilly in the morning. The good thing: no complaints in terms of cleanliness. A big relief! Breakfast is quite decent, too. Not sure if there are better deals in Rome, but I would be willing to push my luck next time.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid room 201”
Reviews.Author: Newcast_eUKK_2
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my partner in this hotel for two nights in November 08. The hotel was booked for us by a company I had to visit in Rome. Like one of the previous reviewers we were assigned room 201. Truly terrible: hardly space to move in, old furniture and exeedingly basic bathroom. Luckily a colleague and his wife were checked into the same hotel and I could compare rooms and realised that not all were as tiny and bad. When I spoke to the receptist there was a lot of humming and ha'ing and that there were only rooms availabe at the front of the hotel which is truly noisy from traffic. Eventually though we did get another room at the rear of the hotel, in fact at the superior floor. These are the room pictures you see on their website. Don't get exited though - these rooms are still quite standard and the beds are very basic. Our bathroom was very good though and new. When we arived the very small lift was out of action - next day it was repaired but by the evening it was out of action again. Pitty the porter who had to schlep the luggage up and down the stairs. Good points: we didn't get charged an upgrade. A small minibar bill was credited because of our troubles and the (male) receptionists were on the whole very helpful. The location is excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable but pricey.”
Reviews.Author: Deluxetoo
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel from October 29 through November 2, 2008. We were 2 adults and 3 children and booked the suite on the 5th floor. The rooms were a bit small but you don't need more because you spend your time outdoor. The place was clean and elegant. The bathroom very comfortable. The breakfast area is wonderful on the roof of the hotel. Everything is good (except the dreadful orange juice). The reception area is small and the staff a bit cold, but nice and helpful. We had a wonderful stay and would recommend the place.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: david_from_Paris
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 day business trip to Rome and stayed at Hotel Tritone booked for me by the travel agency of my company, primarily because central location is great. I would say this is the only advantage of this hotel. As for the rest, pretty terrible. They put me in room 201, horrible bedroom, old and smelly. Bed was old. Furniture also very old. The worst was probably the window would not close properly and I was waken up every morning around 6 by the dustman. Hotel was clean on the other hand which is a good point. Breakfast average but great view on the top floor of the building. Room service is non existing, they have no iron or iron board at guests disposal which is not acceptable. Not a hotel for business trips, defintely.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a little tlc”
Reviews.Author: Barbara02
Reviews.Content: Stayed with two friends in March. Our rooms were standard and, although clean, a bit basic and in need of refurbishment. The rooftop breakfast room was very good and nice breakfast. We could see that the superior rooms on the higher floors were much nicer. Having said that the location was great, the staff very helpful and we did not notice the noise too much. A word of warning about Romne in general. It is not a safe city. My friend was robbed, the official taxi drivers will scam you out of your money and if you are using public transport make sure you validate your tickets otherwise you face an on the spot fine of 50euros

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: pedderz
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on Trip Advisor about this hotel, I was a little worried as they were very mixed. The only negative thing that is true is that the hotel is on a busy road so there is noise from passing traffic, but after a day sight seeing you will probably be so tired you won't notice it - we didn't. I had booked two rooms, both of which had been refurbished and were of a very high standard. The bedding and towels were immaculate as was the room and infact the whole hotel. The breakfast was plentiful with a wide variety of items to suit every taste. The hotel is situated just around the corner from the Trevi Fountain and is within walking distance of all of the major attractions. I would have no double in highly recommending this hotel. If you have never been to Rome before you are in for a real treat as it is a truly fabulous place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location- A Must See”
Reviews.Author: Silverymoon81
Reviews.Content: I was moved from sister hotel, hotel White because of refurbishments' which I initially wasnt too pleased about. But they gave us a superior room (which wasnt grand but nice enough) so I didnt mind too much when we arrived at Tritone. Location is SUPERB. Opposite is a bus terminal & round the corner is a little local supermarket where bottles of water cost 33c (about 20p)!! The Trevi Fountain was 2 mins away and all the other sights within walking distance. Staff were friendly, brekkie was lovely, room was cleaned everyday. Shower was great although the cublicle was tiny (if you're a large person it would be VERY hard to sqeeze into it). I would recommnend this hotel if you didnt want anything too plush. The most important thing was that it was clean and the staff were nice. Although it was too noisy at night because its on a main road so if you dont like being disturbed i wouldnt advise it!

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: ElaineBcn
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay there for 4 nights, the hotel has a great location and staff are friendly; breakfast was excellent: variated and fresh and there was a lovely view of Rome while you're having breakfast. Rooms are small and old, but confortable (overall the -mini-bathroom) but it was ok. I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: BondiinBrussels
Reviews.Content: The staff were fantastically helpful when my baggage was lost by the airline (Alitalia), phoning the airport for updates and seemed genuinely pleased when it arrivedsome 36 hours later (unfortunately I was only staying 48 hours). But the rooms are TINY and noisy, and internet access is a single PC under the stairway, costing 5 Euros. Well located for Trevi fountains, but good walk to other attractions. Recommend Trattoria Tritone 5 min walk.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but”
Reviews.Author: estatictravellers
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel for three nights. It is very central to most of the tourist sites in Rome but on a very busy, noisy street. Sound proofing was not very good and even with the windows closed, the rooms facing the street were very noisy long into the night. We were given a new updated room which was very comfortable and modern with a flat screen TV, however the new bathroom did not have a shower screen which meant the floor was flooded after every shower with only two towels and no bathmat. The best was the breakfast in a lovely glassed enclosed verandah on the 5th floor, plenty to satisfy all tastes. Don't let me put you off completely but I have stayed in better hotels in Rome for less.

Reviews.Title: “This is a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 days at the Tritone and found it comfortable and clean. It is very central and the breakfasts were very good. The only fault we found was the stairs leading from the front door to the checkin counter were a little difficult with suitcases but the porter was very helpful. We loved Roma. We would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Eclectic Room!”
Reviews.Author: tqj
Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed our stay here from the moment we saw the room. The hotel is in a transition stage. The 4th and 5th floors have been very modernized. Wish I had a picture. The bed was a very firm and comfortable futon mattress with a music channel placed above your head. We enjoyed the selection of music so much (instrumental with a decidely international flavor) that we are requesting the source from the hotel. They have a small, flat screen tv that, I believe, comes with computer ports in the room. The wood paneling used was very striking along with the sleek, stainless steel lamps. The best floor to stay on currently is the 4th floor as we did. The breakfast room is down the hall from the 5th floor rooms. The breakfast room is a glass terrace with a nice view while you are eating. The bathroom was very comfortable and modernized as well. You are around the corner from the Trevi Fountain. Has a very small lobby and there is not a lounge, but the new rooms and convenience factor are more than enough for us to recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in Rome”
Reviews.Author: brtoy
Reviews.Content: We just spent 4 days in Rome at the Tritone. Great location but we were very disappointed in the room. Room was dirty: carpet soiled, bathroom dirty, broken furntiure, cigarette burns in drapes and blankets. Only one small elevator big enough for two people. Hotel was definitely not worth 275. a night. We recommend using the Frommer's Italy book for choosing your hotels. We chose our hotels in Venice and Florence from Frommer's and we were very satisfied with the hotels. Tritone was not in the Frommer's book. After reading mixed reviews on Tritone, most positive, we decided to take a chance and stay there. Very disappointed in accommodations. Choose another hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: DragonOntario_Canada
Reviews.Content: Very enjoyable stay at the Tritone in Rome. It is in an excellent situation close to the Trevi Fountain - easy walking to many major sites. Rooms are small which is typical for Europe, but clean and comfortable. Breakfast in the roof-top dining room was very nice with a wide choice of continental breakfast foods and un limited coffee or tea. Staff were polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out!! don't go there”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: completely different from every picture available online, horrible rooms, very very dirty, horrible service to complaints and not worth any more than 5$ a night...

Reviews.Title: “Lovely surprise”
Reviews.Author: BarbSydney
Reviews.Content: After reading s0-so reviews, but still booking - this hotel was a lovely surprise - the rooms were terrific, bathroom ensuite great, bed very comfortable, clean room,the personel very helpful, the breakfasts fabulous from the rooftop overlooking Rome. Very central, we could walk all around Rome, it is situated just behind Trevi Fountain and in the heart of the great shopping area. We loved it and would return if we are lucky enough to revisit Rome.

HotelInfo.Name: Tritone Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 210 Via Del Tritone, 00187 Rome, Italy
